abstract: Steve Lohr Unboxed column notes Google realized early in its history that consumers will usually revert to default option when it is offered to them, insight that led them to invest heavily in becoming default search engine for number of browsers and service providers.
snippet: Google knew early on that being the default search engine on browsers and Web sites would help it surpass competition.
lead_paragraph: Google knew early on that being the default search engine on browsers and Web sites would help it surpass competition.

headline.main: The Default Choice, So Hard to Resist
headline.print_headline: The Default Choice, So Hard to Resist
headline.seo: Default Choices Are Hard to Resist, Online or Not
